skill.name: doc-sync
skill.description: Keeps IdeaVim documentation in sync with code changes. Use this skill when you need to verify documentation accuracy after code changes, or when checking if documentation (in doc/, README.md, CONTRIBUTING.md) matches the current codebase. The skill can work bidirectionally - from docs to code verification, or from code changes to documentation updates.
skill.summary: Keeps IdeaVim documentation in sync with code changes. Use this skill when you need to verify docume...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: No data theft, network exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns detected. The content describes documentation review workflows and local git commands only.

content.user_title: Sync IdeaVim docs with code changes
content.value_statement: Documentation often drifts after code updates and examples become wrong. This skill provides a structured verification workflow to keep IdeaVim docs accurate.
actual_capabilities: Identify documentation locations to review for IdeaVim.
Extract code examples and signatures from docs.
Flag discrepancies and suggest precise updates.
Produce a structured documentation sync report.
limitations: Limited to IdeaVim documentation locations described in the skill.
Requires access to the codebase and git history for verification.
Does not run or compile code to validate behavior.
Ambiguous behavior still needs human judgment.

use_cases.title: Validate release docs
use_cases.description: Check that README and doc/ examples match the latest code before publishing a release.

use_cases.title: Update docs after changes
use_cases.description: Verify documentation when modifying mapping APIs or plugin behavior.

use_cases.title: Audit code examples
use_cases.description: Confirm that function signatures and parameter names in docs are correct.

prompt_templates.title: Check one doc file
prompt_templates.scenario: You edited a single doc file
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify doc/ideavim-mappings.md against current code and report any mismatches.

prompt_templates.title: Review after code change
prompt_templates.prompt: I updated MappingScope.kt. Find doc references and update any incorrect examples.

prompt_templates.title: Full doc audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Check all files in doc/ for outdated signatures and report issues.

prompt_templates.title: Targeted API verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare documentation examples for map() and nmap() against working implementations.

output_examples.input: Check if doc/ideavim-mappings.md is in sync with the code
output: Reviewed doc/ideavim-mappings.md and extracted mapping examples
Found one parameter name mismatch against current API
Recommended a small edit to align with working implementation

best_practices: Start with a working implementation to establish ground truth.
Check git history for deletions before updating docs.
Verify every parameter name in doc examples.
anti_patterns: Updating docs without checking real code usage.
Ignoring deletions when reviewing recent changes.
Making broad rewrites without a specific mismatch.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides instructions that work across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It focuses on IdeaVim docs and does not execute code for validation.

faq.question: Can it integrate with git workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It relies on git log and git show to find breaking changes.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It only references project docs and git history.

faq.question: What if results seem wrong?
faq.answer: Recheck the working implementation and ensure the doc examples are fully extracted.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generic doc checker?
faq.answer: It is specialized for IdeaVim APIs and compares against real implementations.
